block.p: Dr. Kathryn Hartzel Martin Sullivan and Ryan Patrick Hanley were married yesterday at the Bryn Mawr Presbyterian Church in Bryn Mawr, Pa. The Rev. Dr. Eugene C. Bay performed the ceremony.

The bride, who will continue to use her name professionally, is a third-year medical resident in a University of Minnesota program in which she rotates among three hospitals. She graduated from Amherst College, and was a Peace Corps volunteer from 1988 to 1990 in Botswana, where she worked as an English teacher. She received her medical degree from the University of Chicago.
Dr. Kathryn Hartzel Martin Sullivan and Ryan Patrick Hanley were married yesterday at the Bryn Mawr Presbyterian Church in Bryn Mawr, Pa. The Rev. Dr. Eugene C. Bay performed the ceremony.

The bride, who will continue to use her name professionally, is a third-year medical resident in a University of Minnesota program in which she rotates among three hospitals. She graduated from Amherst College, and was a Peace Corps volunteer from 1988 to 1990 in Botswana, where she worked as an English teacher. She received her medical degree from the University of Chicago.

The bride's mother, Phyllis M. Taggart of Indianapolis, retired as an admissions officer for the post-baccalaureate program at Bryn Mawr College. Her father, the late Dr. Howard E. Sullivan Jr., was the chief of allergy and immunology at Bryn Mawr Hospital and an assistant clinical professor of medicine at the University of Pennsylvania in Philadelphia.

The bridegroom is a doctoral candidate in social thought at the University of Chicago. He graduated from Penn and received a master's degree in intellectual history from Cambridge University in England. He is also a member of the Minnesota Mandolin Orchestra, a classical ensemble in Minneapolis.

He is the son of Rosemary C. Hanley and Ronald P. Hanley of Reisterstown, Md. His mother is the psychologist at St. Paul's School for Boys, a private school in Brooklandville, Md. The bridegroom's father works in Perryman, Md., as a manager of Penske Logistics, a unit of the Penske Corporation that delivers retail products.
